Description: (From the abstract) UCSC Genome Browser is a web tool for rapid and reliable display of any requested portion of the genome at any scale, together with several dozen aligned annotation tracks. This browser displays assembly contigs and gaps, mRNA and expressed sequence tag alignments, multiple gene predictions, cross-species homologies, single nucleotide polymorphisms, sequence-tagged sites, radiation hybrid data, transposon repeats, and more as a stack of coregistered tracks
